main

Class TunesSearchApiCaller

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.TunesSearchApiCaller

  • public class TunesSearchApiCaller
extends java.lang.Object
    Searches the https://thesession.org API for a particular tune by matching search terms to tune titles. The API allows the caller to specify the reponse format as JSON, XML or RSS. Here we choose to get the response as JSON. For further information about using this API, see https://thesession.org/API
    Since:
    2017-01-26
    Author:
    Colman O'B

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String searchForTune(java.lang.String searchTermsInput, int resultsPerPage)
      Builds and submits an API query to https://thesession.org, attempting to find a tune matching the user's search terms
      java.lang.String searchForTune(java.lang.String searchTermsInput, int resultsPerPage, int pageNumber)
      Alternative version of this method to allow passing in a particular page number, which can be used to iterate through multiple pages of results

    • Method Detail

      • searchForTune

        public java.lang.String searchForTune(java.lang.String searchTermsInput,
                                      int resultsPerPage)
                               throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Builds and submits an API query to https://thesession.org, attempting to find a tune matching the user's search terms
        Parameters:
        searchTermsInput - The user-input search terms used to match against tune titles in thesession.org database
        resultsPerPage - Specify how many results should be returned per page in the response from the API
        Returns:
        The JSON returned from the API as one big String
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If a HTTP error is encountered when making the API request

      • searchForTune

        public java.lang.String searchForTune(java.lang.String searchTermsInput,
                                      int resultsPerPage,
                                      int pageNumber)
                               throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Alternative version of this method to allow passing in a particular page number, which can be used to iterate through multiple pages of results
        Parameters:
        searchTermsInput - The user-input search terms used to match against tune titles in thesession.org database
        resultsPerPage - Specify how many results should be returned per page in the response from the API
        pageNumber - Specify which page number of the response should be accessed
        Returns:
        The JSON returned from the API as one big String
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If a HTTP error is encountered when making the API request
